summary:
Austria-Hungary was a powerful Central European empire that existed from 1867 to 1918. It was formed by joining two countries, Austria and Hungary, under one monarch. This union created a large, diverse empire with many different ethnic groups.

The empire was made up of three main parts: Austria (called Cisleithania), Hungary (Transleithania), and the Kingdom of Croatia-Slavonia. Bosnia and Herzegovina were also under their control. Austria-Hungary was one of the Central Powers in World War I and declared war on Serbia in 1914. After losing the war, the empire was dissolved, leading to the creation of new countries like Czechoslovakia and Yugoslavia.
title: Austria-Hungary
